bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Adolfo Gonzalez, May 1, 1941

div1.p: Hench informs Gonzalez that he will receive a complimentary copy of the "Proceedings of the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings" on a regular basis.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Adolfo Gonzalez, May 1, 1941
div1.opener:
Same letter to:
Dr. Feliciano Jerez, Gutierrez s/n, Entre Primelles y Mendoza, Reparto “Almendares”
Habana, Cuba
Dr. Tomas Cornejo, Avenida de Columbia #12, Marianao, Cuba
Dr. Gerardo Ane, Calzada Cerro 2015 (Altos), Habana, Cuba
May 1, 1941
Dr. Adolfo Gonzales
Serrano 356
Santo Suarez
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Gonzalez:
div1.p:
On the occasion of a recent visit to the
Military Hospital, I had the great pleasure of meeting
Doctors Ascanio, Iglesias, Randin and others. Doctor Ascanio
told me that you would like to receive the Proceedings of
the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings, and it is with pleasure that
I have asked the editor to send these to you regularly, with
our compliments.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
